app.title: ARTA: AI Art & Photo Generator
app.description:
Want to create artwork without a hassle?

Meet AI Arta—your personal AI-powered art studio designed to turn your ideas into breathtaking works of art. Discover a world of limitless creativity and explore its boundless possibilities:

► Turn words into art
Want to see a BBQ party on Mars or a group of cats having a tea ceremony? Or maybe you're wondering what lies in the far corners of our universe? AI Arta can show you all that and even more! 

Trained using millions of images from the web, this powerful AI picture generator transforms your dreams into visual art in a matter of seconds. Simply write your input and upload a picture to start creating AI-powered art.

► Explore art styles
With this AI picture generator, you can create art using various styles and effects. From AI manga filters and anime-style drawings to mind-blowing photorealism—you can paint anything using artificial intelligence! Experiment with styles and see which one captures your idea best.

► Create art from images
If you have an exact concept of what your painting should look like, you may add the image as a visual base for your prompt. Upload a photo or select a picture from our library, and the AI will transform it into an artistic masterpiece.

► Generate avatars
Step up your selfie game using the AI avatar maker! Upload your photos, and the mighty AI photo generator will create mind-blowing AI avatars. Choose from a variety of AI filters and become the main character of your favorite anime or manga or travel to other fictional universes.

► Get inspired
Get an extra boost of inspiration by browsing a gallery of amazing AI art made by people from all over the world. Explore the ideas of others and start creating AI art using the power of artificial intelligence!

app.summary: AI generated images - headshot, tattoo, cartoon pictures, drawing and painting!

reviews.text: Some of the images are wonderful. But most of the images have NOTHING to do with the very specific prompt that I type in. On top of that, usually faces and limbs are messed up. Also, for about 70 percent of the time I try put in a prompt, it gives me an error message, and after all of that, most of the pics are blurred. I'm actually really disappointed since I paid the lifetime membership for this.

So the ad that persuaded me to consider this purchase should the AI Avatars. As these looked impressive, I forked it for the full license. Only to find however, that the AI Avatar feature costs another £9.99 over and above, for each one you wish to generate. Not even showing you what it looks like before payment. The AI pictures I have tried generating so far are not great compared to some free ones I have used, so overall, cannot recommend this platform unfortunately.

Sort of cool app I guess. The AI has limited ability to look up certain detailed things. I'd say I found about 3 interesting images of the 30 images I saw. Watched ads between every single one of them. Was a bit disappointing I suppose. I kind of expected more. The app doesn't even give clarity on the best way to use the generator. Also just warning people they have very awful Terms of Service. Be careful of that.

They charge a subscription fee just to access the app and then you still have to pay for each avatar. Tried uploading my photos for the avatar and it kept coming up with an error message and I'd have to restart all over again. Gave up after the 4th or 5th attempt. The images I was able to create for free as part of the subscription fee looked terrible like a face with copy and pasted facial features from different images all glued together to make one face (this was not a style I chose)

Amazing little app, learning what prompts to use is key and can take some time to perfect, this is a very easy to use way to start AI art, it can take alot of trial and error, you will not get your perfect image first time , not second or third but you chip away till eventually you have exactly what you are looking for, I've created some absolutely amazing pictures on this, Ive spend countless hours building images on this, it's very fun and addictive. Worth it's asking price no doubt about it

I haven't gotten a single good image. not one. I hate to be that kind of reviewer, but its the truth: most of the time the app will play an ad, then instead of generating the image it gives a "something went wrong" or "no internet" message and goes back to the main screen. the few times it gave me an image it was just an unidentifiable blur; so blurry in fact that you wouldn't even be able to guess what it was supposed to be.

A really good app I'd say, the adds are annoying a little, but can be endored. Only reason why I'm putting a 4 star is because it's difficult to get the right picture first try, and it messes up faces a ton, I had "cat king sitting on a throne" and it looked like something from the backrooms. but in the end it's a pretty good app and can make some beautiful art, and as someone who make art myself, I would say this is fun and just really cool.

There should be a way to thumbs down or guide the AI. You can give it detailed prompts and it will miss the mark completely. Some subject matter is blocked. And when creating artwork with people often times cuts off a portion of the head. I would not recommend paying for this. But is a neat program to play around with.

I definitely would've rated higher if you didn't have to watch an ad every time you generate a photo. It could also just be a total waste of time because some of the pictures just blur out. I don't even know if anyone else has this issue, but overall not that bad for an AI art generator. The AI itself doesn't take much time and most of the pictures it makes are pretty accurate.

Terrible. Unlike most other AI art programs, this one disregards half my prompts and never generates anything close to what I want. Your options as a free user are so limited and bad that I couldn't get a feel for if the paid version might be worth it, but nothing I experienced in the free portion gave me any reason to think giving them money would be a good idea. Oh well, back to the far better alternatives.

app.developerLegalAddress: 66 W Flagler St, Miami, FL 33130-1807, United States

Ready for updates? In this version:
It brings to you:
– Bug fixes and stability improvements

We love getting feedback from you! Please leave your reviews so we can keep making the app even better.
app.AIReview:
ARTA: AI Art & Photo Generator – A Detailed Review

Overview

ARTA: AI Art & Photo Generator is an iOS application designed to democratize art creation through artificial intelligence. Promising to transform user prompts into stunning visuals, the app leverages a vast dataset of images and AI models to generate everything from photorealistic portraits to fantastical landscapes and stylized artwork. With over 3.4 million installs and a solid 4.28-star rating amongst 33,412 users, ARTA has found a significant audience eager to explore the possibilities of AI-driven art generation. The app operates on a free model, making it immediately accessible without any upfront cost. This review will delve into its core features, strengths, weaknesses, and ultimately assess whether ARTA represents a valuable tool for both novice and experienced creatives.

Key Features

ARTA boasts a robust set of features centered around text-to-image generation:

  • Prompt-Based Generation: The heart of the app lies in its ability to interpret user prompts. Users can input descriptive phrases – ranging from simple (“a cat”) to complex, multi-layered concepts (“a cyberpunk samurai meditating beneath a neon waterfall on a desolate planet”).
  • Art Style Selection: Beyond simply generating an image, ARTA offers a diverse range of art styles to apply, including: Realistic, Cartoon, Painting (various traditional painting styles), Sketch, Anime, and more. This allows users to tailor the output to their desired aesthetic.
  • Image Variations: The “V” button generates multiple variations based on the initial prompt and selected style, offering a quick way to explore different interpretations of the same idea. This feature is crucial for refining results.
  • Negative Prompts: A relatively recent addition (as of this review), negative prompts allow users to specify what not to include in the image, significantly improving control over the output and reducing unwanted elements.
  • Resolution Options: ARTA supports generating images at different resolutions - low, medium, and high - balancing quality with processing time and storage space.
  • Image Editing Tools (Basic): The app includes basic tools for cropping, rotating, and adjusting brightness/contrast of generated images before saving or sharing.

Strengths

ARTA’s primary strength resides in its ease of use. Generating art is remarkably straightforward: the user types a prompt, selects an art style, and taps ‘Generate’. The sheer variety of available styles is impressive, allowing users to experiment with vastly different visual outcomes. The app's large install base suggests that it effectively caters to a broad audience – from casual users seeking amusing visuals to those genuinely interested in exploring AI’s creative potential.

Furthermore, the inclusion of negative prompts represents a significant improvement over simpler AI art generators. They dramatically increase control and reduce the frustrating experience of generating images filled with unwanted artifacts or stylistic inconsistencies. The ability to create diverse variations quickly is also a major benefit, saving users considerable time compared to manually tweaking parameters.

Areas for Improvement

Despite its strengths, ARTA has noticeable areas requiring refinement:

  • Image Quality Consistency: While impressive at times, the image quality can be inconsistent. Complex prompts frequently yield stunning results, but simpler prompts often produce images with blurry details or artifacts, particularly at higher resolutions.
  • Prompt Interpretation Nuances: The AI occasionally misinterprets prompts, especially when dealing with abstract concepts or multiple subjects. Fine-tuning prompts through iterative generation is almost always necessary.
  • Limited Editing Features: The basic image editing tools are functional but lack advanced features like layer masking or sophisticated color correction.
  • Processing Speed: Generating images, particularly at higher resolutions and with complex styles, can be slow – sometimes taking upwards of a minute per generation. This could deter users who require quick results.

User Experience

The user interface is clean and intuitive, prioritizing ease of use. The flow from prompt input to image generation is seamless. However, the app's reliance on visual feedback during generation (a spinning animation) could be improved with more informative progress indicators. A clearer indication of how many images are currently in the queue would also be beneficial. Navigating between styles and resolution options is straightforward, though a slightly more refined organization system might enhance discoverability.

Value for Money

ARTA's free model presents significant value for casual users. The ability to generate a large volume of artwork without any financial commitment makes it an attractive option for experimentation. However, the quality of generated images can vary greatly, and achieving truly polished results often requires considerable prompt refinement – effectively demanding a user’s time as a form of “payment.” While there's no in-app purchase model, potential monetization strategies (e.g., offering premium styles or higher resolution options) could be explored without sacrificing the core functionality.

Conclusion

ARTA: AI Art & Photo Generator is a compelling entry point into the world of AI-powered art creation. Its user-friendly interface, diverse style selection, and inclusion of negative prompts make it accessible to users of all skill levels. While image quality consistency and processing speed represent areas for improvement, the app’s free availability and broad appeal justify its popularity. It's a solid choice for anyone curious about exploring AI’s creative potential, but be prepared to invest some time in prompt engineering to consistently achieve the desired results. The app earns a 4/5 rating – a promising foundation with room for continued development and refinement.
